translation.en: She said, "Here." She hands me this piece of paper.
translation.ja: また会った時 パットが手紙をくれて

translation.en: I could hardly wait to get to the next light.
translation.ja: 必死に明かりを探した

translation.en: It was the most beautiful note that Pat wrote.
translation.ja: ステキな手紙だった 感動したわ

translation.en: And she says, "I'm a reader."
And I read lots of stories,
but I've never known where another woman had loved another woman.
translation.ja: “女が女を好きになるなんて 知らなかった”

translation.en: And she says, "Above all things, I hope it's mutual."
translation.ja: “あなたも 同じ気持ちだといいけど”

translation.en: But I wanted to turn around and run back.
[Pat] We almost got locked in the Catholic church once.
[Terry] Because there was a sandstorm.
[Pat] We were walking right down Main Street, and we kissed.
Nobody could see us, because there was a sandstorm.
translation.ja: 砂嵐で見えなかったから

translation.en: [Terry] It was really hard to get together.
[Terry] One time we checked into the hotel with no suitcase or nothing.
translation.ja: 手ぶらでホテルに チェックインしたり

translation.en: [Pat] I can't believe we did that.
[Terry] And I was very well-known there because of sports.
translation.ja: 私は顔が知られてたのに

translation.en: -[Pat] And we played hockey. -[Terry] And we played hockey.
translation.ja: ホッケーでも そうね

translation.en: [Pat] And our pictures would be in the paper. I thought, "Oh, my God. This is not the best thing to do."
translation.ja: 新聞に写真が並んだ時は 本当に焦ったわ 〝ワイルドキャッツ 選手紹介〞

translation.en: [Terry] But when I got her out to the farm, that was happy times.
translation.ja: 彼女を連れて帰省したことも

translation.en: When a holiday would come along, I'd be so excited about going home, and I said to Pat,
translation.ja: 休暇で実家に帰る時 パットを誘ったの

translation.en: I said, "Well, you come home with me, And I'll guarantee you you'll have a good time."
translation.ja: “一緒に帰りましょう 絶対に楽しいから”って

translation.en: So, when she said, "No, I can't do that." I said, "You do that.
You be on that train, and I'll be at the station." And then Pat came off the train.
translation.ja: 私がしつこく誘ったら 列車で来てくれた

translation.en: And we had a good time.
And in the meantime, I was going with Bill from Peoria, and he'd drive all the way up to Canada.
translation.ja: 当時 付き合ってたビルも 車でカナダに来た

translation.en: And I said, "You can come, but don't bring the rain."
translation.ja: 雨を降らせないという条件で

translation.en: He would come in the front door, and I'd go out the back with Terry.
translation.ja: テリーと私で彼を迎え入れた

translation.en: [Pat] I was almost married when I was 18, and the young man I was engaged to...
translation.ja: 18歳で結婚しかけた でも婚約者の男性が…

translation.en: um... died.
Then I was going with another young man. This is during the war.
translation.ja: 次の恋愛は戦争の真っただ中

translation.en: Going with another young man who was a pilot, and he was killed.
translation.ja: パイロットだった彼は 戦死した

translation.en: And then I was going with the son of a farmer.
translation.ja: 次の相手は農家の息子

translation.en: He was on a tractor that rolled over,
and he died.
All of these strange things are happening, and I thought,
translation.ja: あまりにも不幸が続き思った

translation.en: "This is not what I was supposed to do."
That was before I met Terry. That changed everything.
translation.ja: でもテリーに出会い 人生が変わった

translation.en: [Terry] Yeah.
Patty, you were meant for me.
[Pat] I think you're right.
[Terry] But Pat and I both had men interested.
[Pat] Oh, my God. I was with this guy, this Len guy.
Len and I drove down in 1949.
We traveled with her team for two weeks.
So we watched them play, and it was wonderful.
translation.ja: 試合を観戦したの 楽しかった

translation.en: -I roomed with Terry... -[Terry] See? [Pat] ...and he had to stay at a hotel.
translation.ja: 私はテリーと同室 彼はホテル

translation.en: [Pat] And I was a long-distance operator. I could always find you.
translation.ja: 電話交換手だったから 追跡は簡単

translation.en: This is wild. It was after the season, and you'd bought that old car... -[Terry] Yeah. -[Pat] ...with those other gals.
translation.ja: テリーはシーズン後に 数人で古い車を買って

translation.en: And they were driving from Chicago back to Moose Jaw.
translation.ja: シカゴからカナダまで移動

translation.en: [Terry] And that's 1,500 miles--
[Pat] I found her along the way. And I found a motel, and she was there.
translation.ja: 途中のモーテルで 彼女を見つけた

translation.en: I couldn't get away with a thing.
But I was shocked when the phone rang and it was Pat.
translation.ja: 突然 パットから電話が

translation.en: [Pat] "Hi, Terry."
She nearly flipped.
Len, his mother, and his dad wanted me to marry him. His sister was coming after me.
translation.ja: レンの家族は 私と彼の結婚を望んでて

translation.en: His brother was coming after me, and I said, "Terry, we got to leave. We have to get out of here."
translation.ja: 私は耐え切れず テリーに駆け落ちを提案した

translation.en: [Terry] Pat said we were the only two people in the world like this. I said, "Well, let's go to the States."
translation.ja: 同性愛で悩むパットに 私はアメリカ行きを提案

translation.en: [Pat] We thought it would be easier to be ourselves.
translation.ja: 自分らしくいられると思った

translation.en: [Terry] But we didn't know anybody. We were just happy to be together.
translation.ja: 誰も知らないけど お互いがいた

translation.en: I was playing ball. Pat got a job.
translation.ja: 私は野球　パットは仕事

translation.en: And then I went home after ball season to see my dad.
translation.ja: シーズン後に 父の元へ帰省してから

translation.en: And I told Pat I would be back. I came back and got a job.
translation.ja: パットの待つ シカゴに戻り就職した

translation.en: We got this furnished apartment.
It had two rooms.
Had a great big brown old chair that fit the two of us.
translation.ja: 大きな茶色の古いイスに ２人で座った

translation.en: It was hard to meet nice people,
translation.ja: 人付き合いは苦労した

translation.en: which we did after a while.
translation.ja: その後は恵まれたけど

translation.en: We were very careful.
[Pat] Really? You're not sure yet.
What year? What year will you be sure?
translation.ja: いつ解禁されるかしら

translation.en: I have worried about saying something to Al.
translation.ja: アルに言うのは ためらった

translation.en: I had five brothers, and I've lost all but one.
translation.ja: ５人兄弟がいて 彼以外は死んだ

translation.en: And he's three years younger than me, and we're very close. I dearly love him.
translation.ja: アルは３歳年下の弟で 私とはとても仲良し

translation.en: And he loves Terry.
We were on the phone, so I just blurted it out.
translation.ja: ある時 電話で言ったの

translation.en: I said, "You know, Terry and I have been...
together for a long time, many, many years, I think."
And I said, uh,
"You know, we're thinking about getting married."
Big silence.
And he said, "You can't do it. It'd hurt our family."
translation.ja: “やめろ　家族を汚すな”と

translation.en: I said, "How could it possibly hurt our family?"
translation.ja: “なぜ家族が汚れるの？”と 聞くと―

translation.en: He said, "I don't want you to tell anybody in my family."
I thought he'd act this way.
I like Al. He's a wonderful guy, but he's very close-minded.
translation.ja: アルはいい人だけど 考えが保守的だもの

translation.en: I said, "I hope you have a change in your heart."
What else could I say?
So, I mean, if we decide we're going to get married, we will...
translation.ja: 弟の意見は関係なく 話を進める

translation.en: regardless.
Yeah. He won't sway us either way.
translation.ja: 彼に遠慮することはないわ

translation.en: [Pat] No.
And if he can't accept it, that's his problem.
translation.ja: 受け入れてもらう必要はない

translation.en: [Pat] I can't see him walking away from his only sister. I can't see that happening.
translation.ja: 唯一のきょうだいを 失うなんて考えられない

translation.en: I was born in Cabri, Saskatchewan,
translation.ja: 私はサスカチュワン州 ケーブリで

translation.en: on September 27, 1928.
And I had five brothers and a sister.
There were seven of us.
We had a really nice farm. We had cliffs.
translation.ja: ステキな農場で育った 崖登りをしたり詩を書いたり

translation.en: I used to go up there and write poetry.
translation.ja: 崖登りをしたり詩を書いたり

translation.en: And we had creeks, and we had a dam, and some horses.
translation.ja: 小川やため池もあったし 馬もいた

translation.en: My dad had a small dairy.
And he delivered milk to the people in town.
translation.ja: 街の人々に牛乳を届けてた

translation.en: I had two brothers who were in the Air Force during the war.
translation.ja: 兄２人は戦時中 空軍に配属された

translation.en: Uh, and my brother, Wally...
he was my mother's favorite child. He was her favorite.
translation.ja: 母のお気に入りだった

translation.en: Anyway, he wanted to be a pilot. He was only 17.
And she signed for him to join up.
translation.ja: 母が空軍に志願させた

translation.en: And he got to England on his 19th birthday.
translation.ja: そして19歳の誕生日に イギリスへ渡った

translation.en: Oh, my.
[voice breaking] Anyway, he completed all his flights, the whole tour.
translation.ja: ある日フライトを終え 無事に帰還したあとに

translation.en: Then they borrowed him for one more flight, and he was killed.
translation.ja: “あと１回”と 駆り出され死んだ

translation.en: He was shot down over Germany.
Mother died two years later...
I think of heartbreak.
I was only 15 when she died.
After my mother died, my dad remarried.
translation.ja: 母が亡くなったあと 父が再婚した

translation.en: And so I had a stepmother, and a stepsister, and two stepbrothers.
translation.ja: だから私に義母と 義姉(あね) 義兄弟２人ができた

translation.en: We didn't think that she was the greatest mother in the world.
translation.ja: 最高の義母とは言えなかった

translation.en: They would go away for the weekend, and they'd lock all the good food in the basement.
translation.ja: 週末は夫婦で出かけ 食料を倉庫に入れ施錠した

translation.en: What kind of a household is this?
[Pat] 1959, my father and my stepmother were killed
translation.ja: 1959年に 父と義母が事故死した

translation.en: at a railroad crossing.
[Pat] The train hit them, and they were both killed.
Terry's mom and dad came to the funeral.
translation.ja: テリーの両親がお葬式に 〝ジャックとロージー〞

translation.en: They were wonderful to me.
After my mother died, why,
I met Terry's mom and dad.
The very first thing Terry's father said to me is, "I'm going to adopt you."
translation.ja: 私を養子にすると 言ってくれた 〝パットとパパ〞

translation.en: Terry and her family, they loved me, and they... and they showed it.
translation.ja: テリーと彼女の家族は 愛情表現が豊かだった

translation.en: And this is what everybody needs.
You felt that you were loved and cared about.
Hey, that's good!
[Tammy] That's how they play. Did you hear?
Yes. It's great!
[Tammy] Okay. We were gonna write you a fun song,
translation.ja: 楽しい歌を作ろうとしたら

translation.en: but everything that came to me was just a love song.
translation.ja: 楽しい歌を作ろうとしたら ラブソングができた

translation.en: -[Pat] Oh. -[Terry] Oh, that's good.
[Pat laughing] Me heart, me heart.
This is a love song.
-Eh? -[Terry] Yeah.
[Pat] Eh. That's Canadian.
♪ You are my love ♪
translation.ja: あなたは私の愛する人

translation.en: ♪ You are my love ♪
translation.ja: あなたは私の愛する人

translation.en: ♪ So many years together ♪
♪ Many more to come ♪
I hope.
♪ You are my love ♪
translation.ja: あなたは私の愛する人

translation.en: ♪ So many years together ♪
♪ Many more to come ♪
♪ You are my love ♪
translation.ja: あなたは私の愛する人

translation.en: [Pat] That's beautiful.
Tammy, I think after that song, we will get married.
translation.ja: 結婚式で歌ってくれる？

translation.en: Okay?
Can I be a bridesmaid?
[Terry] You can be a bridesmaid.
-[Kim] Can I be the best man? -Yes, you can be the best man.
translation.ja: 僕は花婿介添人 よろしく

translation.en: [Pat] Yes!
Oh, my God.
Can we do that?
Yeah, let's do it.
[Tammy] ♪ You are my love ♪
translation.ja: あなたは私の愛する人

translation.en: [man] How have you been doing with doing the exercises and all?
-[Terry] Good. -[man] Doing 'em?
[Terry] I've been doing them.
What are you having difficulty with at this point?
translation.ja: ジェフ･サンドバーグ 理学療法士 今 つらい部位は？ ジェフ･サンドバーグ 理学療法士

translation.en: It's the-- It's the hip.
-[Jeff] The hip? Okay. -Yeah.
Because you had both hips replaced.
translation.ja: 両方 手術したから

translation.en: -No-- Yeah. They were both replaced. -[Terry] Yeah.
[Jeff] It's important to stay active because of the Parkinson's as well as for those hips and just to stay active for--
translation.ja: パーキンソン病だから とにかく動くしかない

translation.en: I like these exercises very much, and I'll tell you why: they don't go on and on and on.
translation.ja: あの体操は好きよ 回数が少ないから

translation.en: [Jeff] I want to see how well you're getting out of that chair.
-One! -[Jeff and Pat] There you go.
-Two! -That a girl.
-Three! -[Jeff] Get those arms up a little higher.
-Four! -[Jeff] Good.
Five!
Good.
Six!
-Seven! -[Jeff] Beautiful.
Eight!
-Good. Go ahead and relax. -I go to ten.
-You wanna do ten? You can do ten. -[Pat laughing]
-Nine! -That's the athlete in you right there.
-Ten! -[Pat] There you go, Terry.
-There you go. -Nice job.
[Jeff] Bring this foot forwards.
So obviously, some postural changes are normal as we age,
translation.ja: 年を取ると姿勢が悪くなるが

translation.en: but a tendency with Parkinson's, remember, is to lean forward and bend over a little bit.
translation.ja: パーキンソンを患うと 前かがみになりがちだ

translation.en: Like an old lady.
Yeah, but you don't act like an old lady, Terry.
[Pat] Well, you know,
she has days when she's not too bad and then days where it's not so great.
translation.ja: 調子が良くなったり 悪くなったりの繰り返し

translation.en: But tomorrow, she's gonna have a second shot,
translation.ja: 調子が良くなったり 悪くなったりの繰り返し だから明日の治療に懸けてる

translation.en: and we're just praying that this time it's going to help.
translation.ja: だから明日の治療に懸けてる １回目の時は 期待外れだったから

translation.en: Because the first time it did her no good at all.
translation.ja: １回目の時は 期待外れだったから

translation.en: The pain is terrible, and she's on pain pills.
translation.ja: 痛みがひどくて 鎮痛剤を飲んでる

translation.en: You know, she's supposed to take one every four hours.
We're trying to spread that out a bit.
translation.ja: ４時間ごとに１錠だけど 間隔を空けるようにしてる

translation.en: She doesn't take 'em that often.
translation.ja: 間隔を空けるようにしてる

translation.en: But...
Oh.
My one concern is her health.
I want her to be well. I want her to be happy.
There are so many things now that she's not able to do
because of that tremor in her hand.
translation.ja: できないことが増えてる

translation.en: So I watch over everything.
translation.ja: だから私が常に見てる

translation.en: I don't want her to be alone.
It's-- It's a worry.
What she means to me.
[voice breaking] She means everything to me.
Get your cane, and then we'll go.
All righty.
Okay.
I gotta be careful.
Yes. Want me to help you?
[Diana] What's worrying me is, uh, is the deterioration that I'm seeing...
translation.ja: 状態は悪化する一方で とても心配してるわ

translation.en: and the lack of progress that Pat's making in terms of trying to get a plan together
translation.ja: でもパットは動かず 今後の見通しは立っていない

translation.en: to get them moving.
translation.ja: 今後の見通しは立っていない

translation.en: I mean, she's not... she's not... she's not doing anything. She's not budging at all.
translation.ja: 何も決断しないまま 時が過ぎていく

translation.en: And I'm getting frustrated with that.
The problem is Auntie Terry wants to move, and Pat doesn't.
translation.ja: パットが引っ越しを 拒否してるの

translation.en: I think I'm going to have to do an intervention.
I mean, that's the only choice I've got.
-There's nobody home. -[Diana laughs]
-Patty. -[Pat chuckles] Hi, baby.
-How are ya? -Mmm.
-[Pat] Oh, nice to see you at last. -Where's... [grunts]
translation.ja: やっと会えたわね　うれしい

translation.en: -Oh, my goodness, how nice you look. -[Terry] Is that little Diana?
translation.ja: 元気そうね 着いた？

translation.en: Look at you.
-My Diana. -[Terry] Is that little Diana?
I'm scared to see her, Patty.
-Oh, I'm-- I'm doing pretty good-- -Hi!
[Terry] Diana.
That's her little darling.
Good to see you.
[Terry] My God, you must've been tired.
Oh, my God, it's good to see you.
[Terry] Oh, it's wonderful.
Now let me look at you.
-[Pat] She looks wonderful. -You look great.
The last time I saw you guys, Auntie Terry was probably ten or 15,
translation.ja: 前に会った時より ずいぶん痩せたけど ５～10キロほど減った？

translation.en: -maybe even 20 pounds heavier... -[Terry] Yeah.
translation.ja: ずいぶん痩せたけど ５～10キロほど減った？

translation.en: -...than you are now. -[Pat] Exactly.
translation.ja: ずいぶん痩せたけど ５～10キロほど減った？ そうね

translation.en: She should weigh about 125.
[Diana] Are you eating?
Yeah, I'm eating.
[Pat] I don't know if she's eating enough, though.
translation.ja: 量は少ない でしょうね

translation.en: [Diana] Yeah, probably not, eh. You got a good appetite?
translation.ja: でしょうね 前はよく食べた

translation.en: Well, I been eating... as much as you, Pat.
translation.ja: 今も食べてる パットと同量は

translation.en: [Pat] No.
[Diana] You've got the frozen dinners now coming in?
[Pat] Yeah. We have frozen dinners that we buy.
This is the time in your life where you should be having people cook your meals. You should be having people clean your house. This is the time...
translation.ja: もう今は料理とか掃除は 他人に任せる段階に来てる

translation.en: that you should be not worrying about anything,
translation.ja: 心配せずに過ごすべきよ

translation.en: and I think all we're all doing is worrying like crazy over what's gonna happen.
translation.ja: 私たちは行く末が 心配で仕方ないの

translation.en: [Terry] Well, I had a dream.
I dreamt that we sold the place with everything in it,
translation.ja: 家を中身ごと売却すること

translation.en: and that's the way I think we should go.
[Pat] Oh, I can't do that.
Like these chairs, no way am I gonna leave these.
translation.ja: このイスは手放さない

translation.en: -Oh, Pat. You-- You-- -I am not going to leave these chairs.
translation.ja: でも… イスは絶対に手放さない

translation.en: Those two lamps are going to go with us, that's for sure.
Paintings. We're going to take the paintings, certainly.
[Terry] All this stuff... There's stuff all over the place.
translation.ja: でも家には 物があふれてるのに

translation.en: [Diana] You can keep your stuff. Nobody's gonna tell you. You don't have to give your stuff away, but we got to get you out of here.
translation.ja: 手放す必要はないけど ここでは暮らせない

translation.en: I mean, I guess we have to figure out what place you want to live in.
translation.ja: どこに住むかを決めないと

translation.en: Like, do you want to live here or Florida? I know you don't want to come to Canada.
translation.ja: ここかフロリダか カナダは嫌でしょ？

translation.en: No. You know, Edmonton really doesn't turn me on.
translation.ja: エドモントンには引かれない

translation.en: And I don't know why, but it doesn't.
translation.ja: 理由は分からないけど

translation.en: [Diana] Well...
[Pat] I loved Sarasota.
[Terry] Yeah, I like Florida, too.
translation.ja: 私もフロリダは好きよ

translation.en: It's very beautiful, and I have a good time when I'm down there.
translation.ja: 私もフロリダは好きよ 旅行は楽しかったけど

translation.en: But it's no place for us now.
translation.ja: 住むのは現実的じゃない

translation.en: [Pat] Nice and warm. Nice and green.
[Terry] And I can't drive. You don't know how long you can drive, and then you're stuck out there.
translation.ja: 私は運転できないし あなたも長くは無理よ

translation.en: You're looking at a golf course
and little stream of water.
-[Diana chuckles] -Got a little stream of water.
I-- That's not the place.
Not the place.
It wouldn't be so bad even if you found a nice place and stay here.
translation.ja: ここに残る手もある ステキな施設を見つけて

translation.en: -[Diana] In St. Charles? -Yeah.
[Diana] They must have nice places here that you can go into.
translation.ja: この辺にも いい施設はあるはず

translation.en: They're very expensive.
[Diana] Yeah, but it's gonna get very expensive anyway if one of you gets sick
translation.ja: そうだけど １人が倒れ 24時間介護を頼めば

translation.en: and the other one has to have a full-time person in here.
Then maybe we should start looking at places here.
Do you think?
Yeah.
[Diana] Patty?
I suppose we could. Mm-hmm.
[Diana] So when you're standing up like this, is it hurting you?
translation.ja: こうやって立つと痛い？

translation.en: No, it doesn't hurt right now.
I'm playing bridge today at the CU.
translation.ja: あなたに会えて絶好調

translation.en: Auntie Terry, we got to sort this out.
Yeah, we got to go to Edmonton.
We can go away in the winter.
I don't think you're going to get agreement on that, darling.
translation.ja: 同意を得るのは難しそう

translation.en: [Diana] Pull up that place that you just mentioned. Dell-- Dell something.
translation.ja: さっき言ってた デル何とかって所は？

translation.en: I think it's Delnor Glen.
[Diana] I can look it up on here so you can keep doing what you're doing.
[Pat] No. I just want to get rid of this.
That's your pill, Terry.
You make sure you eat this whole thing.
translation.ja: これ全部 食べてね

translation.en: -Okay. -You have to.
-Pat? -[Pat] Hmm?
[Diana] If we went to that place today...
translation.ja: 今日 見学する時にね

[Pat] You always do treat me nice, sweetheart.
You're a beautiful little girl.
There you go.
There you go, my dear.
-I love you, Patty. -I love you too, sweetheart.
translation.ja: 愛してる 私も愛してる

translation.en: [Terry] You're going to be okay.
You better be a good girl and eat.
translation.ja: だから ちゃんと食べてね

translation.en: Oh, Terry.
Terry, I'm trying all I can.
But if I can't eat, I can't-- I can't eat.
translation.ja: でも食欲は― 湧かない

translation.en: [Terry] Listen, honey. Don't you worry.
[Diana] Well, honey, you know I worry about you,
and I just want you both to be happy and healthy.
translation.ja: 幸せでいてほしいから

translation.en: I know that damn Parkinson's is tough to manage,
translation.ja: でもパーキンソンは 手ごわい病気よね

translation.en: and I remember what you told me about growing old isn't for sissies.
translation.ja: 根性で立ち向かえる 相手じゃない

translation.en: [laughs, sniffles] And so, you're a tough cookie, and I know you're hanging in there,
translation.ja: でも２人は強いから頑張れる

translation.en: but if you need me, all you have to do is call me, okay?
translation.ja: つらい時は いつでも電話して

translation.en: -[Pat] Yeah. -[Terry] We will.
[Diana] And, Patty, promise me you'll phone me if you need me to come down.
translation.ja: パット いつでも会いに行くから

translation.en: [Pat] Honey, I will. I will.
Okay.
Bye. Love you. Bye.
[Pat] Bye-bye.
[Pat VO] When we thought about it and talked about it,
we decided the best thing to do was to come back to Canada.
translation.ja: ２人で話し合った結果 カナダに戻ることにした

translation.en: There you are. Hi, honey.
translation.ja: そこにいたの テリー

translation.en: -[Terry] Get in there. -[man] I'm gonna help you, all right?
translation.ja: そこにいたの テリー 乗って 手伝うよ

translation.en: [Pat chuckles] Get in there, she says.
-Here I am, Terry. -[man] Okay.
Give her a hug.
[Terry] Get over here.
[Pat] Would you like a good morning kiss or something?
-[Terry] No, not until you-- -[Pat] Not until I sit down?
translation.ja: まずは… 座らないと

translation.en: We've got to get going.
You should talk.
-You're giving it to me today, aren't you? -Yes, I am.
translation.ja: 今日は冷たいのね まあね

translation.en: That's okay. I love you, anyway.
[Diana] Come on, Auntie Terry, you gotta be nice to your little honey.
translation.ja: パットに優しくしてあげて

translation.en: -[Pat] She won't even give me a kiss. -[Diana] How come?
-Terry? -[Terry] What?
-You want to give me a good morning kiss? -[Terry] I'm thinking about it.
translation.ja: 朝のキスは？ まだ考え中

translation.en: [Pat] You're thinking about it?
All right, you tell me when you're ready.
I'm looking at the camera.
Here, come on. Give me a kiss.
[man] Is everyone ready? We're moving.
-[Diana] We're moving? Okay. -[Pat] Okay.
[Pat] Oh, there's our house, Terry.
-[Terry] Yeah. -[Pat] Oh.
[Terry] Twenty-six years there.
Twenty-six years.
[Pat] Yeah.
Loved it. Absolutely loved living there.
-Didn't we, Terry? -[Terry] Yep.
And now we're going on.
♪ Plant a money tree Grow a love so free ♪
[Pat and man] We're in Canada!
-[Diana] We're in Canada! -[Pat] We're in Canada!
Canada!
♪ And if I should fall so deep and true ♪ ♪ And if I should fall so deep ♪
[man] Second base coming up.
Slide. Pshh!
[man] You were kind of breaking the rules back then.
[Terry] Exactly.
[Terry] All of us that played ball in the '40s broke the rules.
translation.ja: 40年代の 女子野球選手はみんな

translation.en: [man] You kind of broke the rules your whole life.
[Terry] Yes, I have.
That's why I'm happy.
Right? [laughing]
-[man] Felt good to break the rules? -[Terry laughing] Yes.
[Tammy] You're in Canada. You're here!
-[Terry] Yeah. -Yeah! [laughing]
[man] But anyway, you guys, you're home with family.
I'm glad you're here.
[Pat] I think it was a great move because I think that Terry,
translation.ja: 引っ越しは英断だった

translation.en: especially Terry, needed to be here with family.
translation.ja: 特にテリーにとって 家族といられるもの

translation.en: [Diana VO] I did manage to get them here,
and so now that I've got them here, I'm really grateful for it
and whatever I have to do, I'm going to do.
I just am so glad they're here. I am so glad they're both here.
translation.ja: ２人とも来てくれて うれしい

translation.en: [Terry] No regrets.
I'd do it all over again.
translation.ja: 人生を謳歌(おうか)した

translation.en: I think love is love, and that's the most important thing.
translation.ja: 何よりも大切なのは愛
